channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @bogiperson Let's see. A quick google says His height is 236,000 parasangs, each being 3 miles. Roughly, that's 600k miles to a 6' foot tall man, or a ratio of 100k X 5.286k or (again roughly) a scale of 500 million to 1.
item.source:markdown: @bogiperson Let's see. A quick google says His height is 236,000 parasangs, each being 3 miles. Roughly, that's 600k miles to a 6' foot tall man, or a ratio of 100k X 5.286k or (again roughly) a scale of 500 million to 1.

item.description: "A prominent Reform synagogue has argued that parents suing over alleged child sex abuse waived their right to bring forth a lawsuit when they signed activity waivers upon enrolling their children in school." https://t.co/nQOPlNDl7b
item.source:markdown: "A prominent Reform synagogue has argued that parents suing over alleged child sex abuse waived their right to bring forth a lawsuit when they signed activity waivers upon enrolling their children in school." https://t.co/nQOPlNDl7b

item.description:
@bogiperson Oooh! Please email me copyright page!

@bogiperson I wonder what a 6x9" portion of a giant God would look like.... #CoverDesignThoughts

item.description:
@MisfitTorah To be fair to YU, I felt the same as a straight student back in the day.

@MisfitTorah One of the most important lessons I learned at Yeshiva College is that Institutions act neither for the good of the ostensible human constituents, or toward their stated values, but for their self preservation and aggrandizement. An important but painful lesson.
item.source:markdown:
@MisfitTorah To be fair to YU, I felt the same as a straight student back in the day.

item.description:
@bernstein_judah Yes. Cf Gary Rosenblatt’s Substack post lamenting that Jewish organizations didn’t back up @yaffedorg’s complaint. https://t.co/dYtXvziBZf

@bernstein_judah @yaffedorg Incidentally, if I had to pick a closing date for a study of American Jewry that begins in June 1967, it would end with Gary stepping down from the Jewish Week.
item.source:markdown:

item.description:
@WinterlightHome There are probably a couple small schools in those towns with similar educational neglect, but nothing massive on the scale of the Satmar system in NY — and bringing in that kind of state aid.

@WinterlightHome Chabadniks will send their kids to a community day school, but if there is a critical mass will start their own cheder.
item.source:markdown:
@WinterlightHome There are probably a couple small schools in those towns with similar educational neglect, but nothing massive on the scale of the Satmar system in NY — and bringing in that kind of state aid.
@WinterlightHome Chabadniks will send their kids to a community day school, but if there is a critical mass will start their own cheder.

item.description:
@DemocraticLuntz So you're saying he hates when that happens?

@DemocraticLuntz I just casually assumed that his hell is being sentenced to be the videographer in someone else's sex-crazed heaven. JFK's, perhaps.

item.description:
“It is entirely possible for yeshivas to offer enriching English, math, and science education at the same time as a strong grounding in religious texts and Jewish tradition – indeed, many do.” https://t.co/XlTxV90ySS

“I know it personally, because many of my friends and colleagues are smart, well-educated yeshiva graduates.”

Nice to see the seamless spectrum of Orthodoxy being used against the right, for a change.

On the organizational level, Agudah has Satmar’s back. The OU seems to have been conspicuously silent.

Note that Lander is a city-wide elected official, so his constituents include Orthodox Jews who resent the implicit (and sometimes explicit) chassidic claim that they’re G-d-forsaking goyim for educating their children in English and math.
item.source:markdown:
“It is entirely possible for yeshivas to offer enriching English, math, and science education at the same time as a strong grounding in religious texts and Jewish tradition – indeed, many do.” https://t.co/XlTxV90ySS
“I know it personally, because many of my friends and colleagues are smart, well-educated yeshiva graduates.”
Nice to see the seamless spectrum of Orthodoxy being used against the right, for a change.
On the organizational level, Agudah has Satmar’s back. The OU seems to have been conspicuously silent.
Note that Lander is a city-wide elected official, so his constituents include Orthodox Jews who resent the implicit (and sometimes explicit) chassidic claim that they’re G-d-forsaking goyim for educating their children in English and math.

item.description:
@DreadMuller @samstein @jaketapper If America’s Mayor has been paying attention, a kosher meal order wouldn’t necessary disqualify a lawyer from being an observant Muslim. Considering kosher meat to be halal is a mainstream shariah position.

@DreadMuller @samstein @jaketapper He’d be taking a gamble that no wine or alcohol was used in the cooking, but probably not an unreasonable gamble.

@DreadMuller @samstein @jaketapper Pretty sure that Mukasey is an observant Jew.

@DreadMuller @samstein @jaketapper The “anti-Shariah Law” movement radicalized knowledgable Orthodox Jews against islamophobia, because Shariah plays an identical role in American jurisprudence as does Jewish Halacha. As it pretty much does in Israel.
@DainyBernstein This is probably a good source for quotes in defense of giving frum kids a decent secular education.
item.source:markdown: @DainyBernstein This is probably a good source for quotes in defense of giving frum kids a decent secular education.

item.description: @bernstein_judah The goal of the Republican project is for taxpayers to fund unaccountable schools run by radical clerics. Satmar education is the desired end game.

item.description: @HeerJeet I can’t believe a politician would give an answer other than Jesus or MLK to that question.

item.description:
@AkivaMCohen I also think that any strategic thoughts we Twitter randos might have regarding the Republican Party or Putin or the like were available to the professionals making the relevant decisions.

@AkivaMCohen Either these thoughts were raised and dismissed, or the decision making process is so broken that nothing we say on here — or even a NYTimes Op Ed — will penetrate.
item.source:markdown:
